title: French Cuisine
description: France is known for its food culture including croissants, cheese, and wine.

title: Baguette Tradition
description: Baguettes are a staple in French meals and are often bought fresh daily.

title: Café Culture
description: French people enjoy sitting at cafés for long conversations and people-watching.

title: Fashion Capital
description: Paris is considered one of the fashion capitals of the world.

title: Politeness Matters
description: Saying 'Bonjour' and 'Merci' is very important in daily French interactions.

title: Art and Museums
description: France is home to famous museums like the Louvre and Musée d'Orsay.

title: Wine Culture
description: Wine is a central part of French meals and traditions.

title: The French Riviera
description: The south of France is famous for its beaches and luxury lifestyle.

title: French Literature
description: France has a rich literary history including authors like Victor Hugo and Voltaire.

title: The Eiffel Tower
description: One of the most iconic landmarks in the world, located in Paris.
